page.title: 09PURBROOK SHEEPWASH FARM
page.content: In our square is{SHEEPWASH FARM.} It is quite near Purbrook Heath. We visited and asked the farmer questions. We found out that it was a family farm. The primary land cover is grassland sown with rye seeds. We walked through some fields where they were growing Barley and Winter Wheat. The farm also has animals. They have Jersey cos called "PURWICKS". The PUR stands for Purbrook and the WICK for Southwick. The farm produces cream which is sold locally. They have many pigs which they keep at Closewood north of the farm. Ducks live by the stream which sometimes gets polluted by industrial waste from Waterlooville.
